contacts_introduction.message: This is my first browser extension I made not for personal use so don't be hard on it — better contact me and tell about a bug or suggest an idea. I won't ignore anyone and will answer as fast as I read the message.

contacts_valenok.message: This is my mate who helped me to fix some grammar mistakes because my english sucks. You can contact her too (russian and english):

faq_access_token.message: What is API key (a.k.a access token)?

faq_question_access_token.message: API keys are a way to grant third-party tools and applications partial read-only access to your Guild Wars 2 account. To use this extension you should create API key at account.arena.net/applications with "tradingpost" permission and enter it at settings page.

faq_question_how_it_works.message: This extension uses official Guild Wars 2 API to retrieve information about your trading post transactions. You can track specific items you are waiting to buy or sell — just press the eye button and extension will notify you when this item will be sold or bought. Due to Guild Wars 2 API isn't rich enough it's hard to check the fact of selling an item so you will receive selling/buying notification even if the tracked item will be removed from your transaction list by yourself. Also your transaction list in the extension refreshes every 5 minutes because of Guild Wars 2 API restrictions, so you may wait up to 5 minutes to get the latest information.

faq_is_it_safe.message: Is this extension safe for my account?

faq_question_is_it_safe.message: Yes, using applications based on official Guild Wars 2 API is safe for your account because official API provides only read-only access to not intimate information. For example, application developers can't get your email, serial number, password and other stuff. Make sure that this extension doesn't connect to any of my servers and it's fully working with Guild Wars 2 API without third-party servers (you can check it by pressing "Details" link on chrome://extensions/ page).

faq_is_it_legal.message: Is this extension legal to use?

faq_question_is_it_legal.message: Yes, you don't violate the rules of the Guild Wars 2 user agreement by using this browser extension.

faq_question_release_ideas.message: If your idea is feasible, cool, and useful, then yes. Check out contact page for contact info.

faq_localization.message: Is this extension available in other languages?

faq_question_localization.message: This extension is only available in russian and english now. To switch the language you should change browser's language in Chrome settings. If you know any language very well and if you want to support this extension in the future (for example if I'll add new options) you can contact me.

faq_browsers.message: Is this extension available for any other browsers?

faq_question_browsers.message: No. I won't create the extensions for the other browsers without any strong reasons.

faq_unknown_error.message: Why do I get random "unknown error" errors?

faq_question_unknown_error.message: I don't know why this shit happens. Issue isn't in my code. Looks like it's the impact of the anti-virus or Guild Wars 2 servers' issue.

faq_dont_refresh_oftenly.message: Looks like the extension doesn't working for me anymore. Why?

faq_question_dont_refresh_oftenly.message: It's probably because you are saving data too often. Chrome doesn't allow more than 120 saving operations per minute and more than 1800 operations per hour. Each action (selling/buying item, saving settings, starting tracking item) is one operation. I can't do anything with it. Please do these operations less often. If the problem isn't in the frequency of the operations, check out storage usage at debug page. If it's full reset all data in settings.

app_description.message: Track your auction buying and selling orders and get notifications when you sold or bought anything.

reset_alarm_warn.message: This option resets all loop timers that check for status of your transactions. The extension will be closed after the reset. Don't use this function if you don't understand what it does.

cl_1_1_0_0.message:
• Added the time elapsed since the item was put into the trading post.
  • Added the "Track all" and "Untrack all" buttons.
  • Added difference between your and cheapest seller's price (or most expensive buyer's price).
  • Added the time elapsed since the item listing was updated last time.
  • Added transaction history pages.
  • Extension errors are logging now. If something goes wrong check out the debug page and send me this information.
  • Fixed a problem when the extension worked incorrectly if you are selling or buying more than 200 items simultaneously.
  • Optimization improvements.
  • UI improvements.
  • Minor bugfixes.

timeout_error_price_range.message: Timeout error occured while trying to receive price range information.

unknown_error_price_range.message: Unknown error occured while trying to receive price range information. Please reload this page to try again.

price_difference_sell.message: The difference between your and best seller's price

price_difference_buy.message: The difference between your and best buyer's price

algorithm_1.message: The extension will notify you about only items you are tracking right now

algorithm_2.message: The extension will notify you about every sold and bought item

algorithm_changed.message: The algorithm has been successfully changed.

faq_algorithm.message: What's the difference between the so-called algorithms?

faq_question_algorithm.message:
That's a good question, read this properly too make the right choice.

First algorithm:

You will receive notifications only about the currently tracked items, so notifications won't disturb you much. The problem is that you will receive notifications even if you remove your order from trading post.

Second algorithm:

You receive notifications about every successful transaction. The problem is you will receive notifications even if you buy or sell an item without order.

cl_1_1_1_0.message:
• Fixed localization issues from previous version.
  • I forgot to turn off developer mode in extension sources in the previous version.

sound_changed.message: Volume of notifications has been successfully changed.

sound_setting.message: Volume of notifications is regulated by a number from 0 (it's 0%) to 1 (100%). Recommended volume is 0.1 (10%).

cl_1_1_2_0.message:
• Fixed a bug with the algorithm switcher.
  • Added a volume regulation.

vote_reminder.message: Holy quaggan! Looks like you're like this extension (I hope) so I want to beg you rate this extension at Chrome store page. But if you're lazy to do it you can just hide this notification. Thank you.

cl_1_1_3_0.message:
• Added information about extension installation date at the bottom of the debug page (each settings reset will refresh this date).
  • Added begging to rate the extension at Chrome store to users who use the extension more than two weeks.
  • Added new setting which allow you to choose language of item names.
  • Added new setting which allow you to choose between two new algorithms.
  • Reduced size of the extension.
